message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit steep for me. Would you be willing to consider a price of $90?

I understand your concerns, Bob, but I'm still looking to make a decent profit on this product. How about we meet in the middle at $105? It's a fair compromise, and I think you'll still get a great deal.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but $105 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. Would you be willing to go down to $95?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $95. How about we meet in the middle again at $100.50? It's still a good compromise, and I think you'll be happy with the price.
I'm getting close to walking away, Alice. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can only go as low as $97.50. Can you meet me there?

I understand you're getting close to walking away, Bob, but I'm not willing to give up yet. I'll meet you halfway again at $99.25. It's still a good price for both of us, and I think we can come to an agreement.
I'm still not comfortable with $99.25, Alice. I'm willing to go up to $98.50, but that's my final offer. If you're willing to meet me there, I'll make the deal.
I understand your final offer, Bob, but I'm still looking to get a better price for my product. I'll meet you halfway again at $99.00. It's my last offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
I've made it this far, and I'm not willing to go back on my word. My final offer is $98.00. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to walk away.
